title: Jhin's Log-In Music
body: Is pretty incredible I gotta say, it's probably my favorite one so far. Props to Riot

replies.body: Thanks for liking the music, AH Mason! This champ was certainly a very special one to write music for :)
I've been wandering what the style of Jhins music is called from the virtuoso video. Is there a specific name for it?

> [{quoted}](name=EliteKat,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=RcP7grnh,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2016-04-13T17:47:55.205+0000)
>
> I've been wandering what the style of Jhins music is called from the virtuoso video. Is there a specific name for it?

Hey EliteKat,

Sorry for the super late reply, I've been away from the boards writing like crazy for a while. 

I am not aware of any particular name for the style of music featured in the video. I guess that it falls under the umbrella of "game music", which, I realize, doesn't help you at all. It's not really choir music as people traditionally describe it, it could almost be a (albeit very short) violin concerto.

Thanks for listening!
too bad his gameplay isn't as good as his music

Despite the fact that his gameplay is a bit underwhelming and inconsistent in general, when you DO get to pull off his kit it's incredibly satisfying and leaves the enemy with few ways to answer. Personally I think the point of mastery for Jhin is to play well enough to reduce that inconsistency.

I personally like how cerebral his playstyle is, and when he snowballs he can deal with most threats to him by himself. There's nothing funnier than seeing someone like master yi get kited by a jhin who invested in a little attack speed.
My personal favorite from you is the Rek'Sai theme. Maybe (100% totally) it's because I'm in love with everything rek'sai, but that theme really feels like a more intense Jaws theme. Perfect.
Same here. I just love the music style. Sets me back every Login to when i played Bioshock 1 for the very first time.
Ekko's music is the best imo.
